title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Abilene, TX) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It’s a long process from start to finish. I had multiple interviews with multiple department heads. Had 2 phone interviews and 2 in person interviews. You start out with two phone interviews and then you move to in-person interviews. You meet multiple directors and other fellow admission counselors.
Interview Questions: How do you handle parents who are considered about their bottom line when it comes to tuition?

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Addison, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Quick responsiveness to schedule interviews. You'll do a panel interview where you'll meet with leadership, potential manager, and coworkers. They do a brief presentation about ACU and your role. You'll shadow a coworker for 30-45 minutes before finishing up the interview. You'll typically hear back within a few days.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this position and University?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: THis was a few years ago, but it was minimal,at the time, There was no online teaching and they seemed to give the most weight to past and current experience.
Interview Questions: Only about experience past and present

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions:
it was super friendly.
The interviewer was respectful and the whole process was open communication. They take references into consideration and they will probably know you or know someone that does, your professors or classmates.
Interview Questions:
tell me about you?
tell me what do you want to get out of this job?
tell me how do you fit in this job and why are you looking for us?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Abilene, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I met with a committee.  Even though there were several people, they made it very comfortable.  They were prepared with multiple questions and very organized.  They made ACU a very inviting place!
Interview Questions: What would I do if a student wanted to meet with the chair.

title: Graduate Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: The process was not only easy but it was also rather straight forward.  From beginning to end I knew where I stood and nothing was out of the ordinary at all.  Great!
Interview Questions: What is motiving you to look at ACU?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: You just meet with a person within the department. I suggest conversing with one in advance. I discussed the opportunity of being a G.A. before entering a grad program. Then obviously you just apply online
Interview Questions: Why you want to be a G.A., what are you career plans, stuff like that, etc.

title: Front Desk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: Great experience for students that wants to get a job.  The interview was very professional and the interviewer was very helpful and easy to talk to. It's a great experience for students who wants to try get a job in college
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: Walked in and was hired on the spot.  Asked about class schedule and other extra school activities to build a schedule.  Pay is low but very flexible job for school.
Interview Questions: What is your major

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Abilene, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Face to Face 2 interviewers, the environment was comfortable as we sat at a conference table. offered drinks and small talk. very passionate about Christ centered education and very good listening skills by hiring team. Encouraging and honest about job
Interview Questions: Strengths? weaknesses? general questions like that

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews. Company looking to uphold christian values. Management experience is preferred. Experience with education IS A MUST. You will be working with students the majority of the time. They are looking for leadership, team work experience, and work ethic.
Interview Questions: Career goals

title: Director of Student Administrative Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Abilene Christian University
Interview Descriptions: Formal process. All application and information submitted through HR. Phone interview first, followed by in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Define your philosophy of customer service

title: Residence Hall Desk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Abilene, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took one phone call and I was offered a job! I did not go through an in person or any other stage in the application. the application does not require a lot.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to apply for this job?

title: Department Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Abilene Christian University (Abilene, TX) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was already employed there as a dorm lab monitor. One day I was talking to one of my supervisors and his supervisors was listening in on our conversation. That's when he decided to offer me the part time position.
Interview Questions: N/A
